title: ML: Precision and Recall
story: Precision: of predictions marked positive, how many are truly positive? Recall: of all actual positives, how many did we catch?
instructions: Calculate precision and recall from: TP=3, FP=1, FN=2. Precision = TP/(TP+FP), Recall = TP/(TP+FN). Print both rounded to 2 decimals.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

TP = 3  # True Positives
FP = 1  # False Positives
FN = 2  # False Negatives

precision = TP / (TP + FP)
recall = TP / (TP + FN)

print(round(precision, 2))
print(round(recall, 2))
